title: Cricket-crazy fans set to add a kicker to India's economy as world cup begins
summary: As the 2023 ICC Cricket World Cup kicks off in India, the tournament is expected to provide a significant boost to the country's economy through increased tourism, hospitality, and consumer spending. Cricket legend Sachin Tendulkar made an appearance at the opening match at Narendra Modi Stadium.
content:
The ICC Cricket World Cup 2023 commenced with much fanfare at the Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad, India, featuring the opening match between England and New Zealand. Cricket legend Sachin Tendulkar made a special appearance, greeting fans while presenting the World Cup trophy ahead of the match.

The tournament, being hosted entirely in India, is anticipated to generate substantial economic benefits for the country. With millions of cricket enthusiasts expected to attend matches across various venues, sectors such as hospitality, tourism, and local businesses are projected to see significant growth.

The six-week-long tournament is likely to drive increased consumer spending, hotel bookings, and travel activities across host cities. Additionally, television viewership and digital streaming are expected to reach record numbers, benefiting media and advertising industries.

## Opening Ceremony

The ICC Cricket World Cup 2023 commenced with much fanfare at the Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad, India, featuring the opening match between England and New Zealand. Cricket legend Sachin Tendulkar made a special appearance, greeting fans while presenting the World Cup trophy ahead of the match.

## Economic Impact

The tournament, being hosted entirely in India, is anticipated to generate substantial economic benefits for the country. With millions of cricket enthusiasts expected to attend matches across various venues, sectors such as hospitality, tourism, and local businesses are projected to see significant growth.

The six-week-long tournament is likely to drive increased consumer spending, hotel bookings, and travel activities across host cities. Additionally, television viewership and digital streaming are expected to reach record numbers, benefiting media and advertising industries.
